Team

Who we are

This page contains the list of the group members, past and present.

Dr. Fotis Psomopoulos | Principal Investigator C'

Dr Fotis E. Psomopoulos works as a Principal Investigator C’ (Assistant Professor level) at the Institute of Applied Biosciences (INAB) of the Centre for Research and Technology Hellas (CERTH), with a primary focus on bioinformatics workflows and computational analysis of large bio-datasets. He has received his doctorate and engineering diploma from the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering at the Aristotle University of Thessaloniki (AUTH), in 2010 and 2004 respectively. In 2014 he has been awarded with a post-doctoral fellowship scholarship by the AUTh Research Committee. He has worked as a teaching assistant and academic fellow at the Aristotle University of Thessaloniki, as a Visiting Professor at Quest University (Vancouver, Canada) and as an Adjunct Lecturer at the University of Western Macedonia. Moreover, he has participated as a researcher and project manager in several European (RAPP, Microme, ASSIST) and national research projects.

Nikolaos (Nikos) Pechlivanis | PhD student

Nikos Pechlivanis works as a Bioinformatics engineer at the Institute of Applied Biosciences in the Centre for Research and Technology Hellas. He holds an engineering diploma of Electrical and Computer Engineering from the Aristotle University of Thessaloniki (AUTH) where he completed his thesis entitle “Genomic data integration for facilitating machine learning applications”. Currently he is pursuing a PhD in the field of Computation Biology and Bioinformatics under the supervision of Dr. Fotis Psomopoulos. His research focuses on studying machine learning algorithms and computational techniques with respect to their corresponding applications on genomic and meta-genomic data. In addition to his research, Nikolas supports open source/science principles, in support of reusability and accessibility of scientific results. Moreover, he is interested in web development mostly working on server-side scripting by applying data wrangling and analysis techniques.

Maria Christina Maniou | Research assistant

Maria Christina Maniou is a research assistant at Institute of Applied Biosciences in Centre for Research and Technology Hellas (INAB/CERTH). She received an engineering diploma of Electrical and Computer Engineering (Integrated Master Level 7) from the Aristotle University of Thessaloniki, in 2020. Her Diploma Thesis was titled: “Development of an algorithm for correlation of Chromosomal Locations with functional biological processes using large-scale data analysis”. During her studies, she completed a three-month internship at INAB/CERTH, as well as, a three-month internship at Institute of Applied Computer Science in Kiel University of Applied Sciences. Her research interests focus on data science and analytics and their respective application on genomic, epigenomic and transcriptomic data. Moreover, her interests include data visualization, as well as, the development of software tools and pipelines for implementing new bioinformatic approaches.

Iasonas Ofeidis | Research assistant

Iason Ofeidis works as a research assistant at the Institute of Applied Biosciences in the Centre for Research and Technology Hellas (INAB/CERTH). He received an engineering diploma in Electrical & Computer Engineering from the Aristotle University of Thessaloniki in 2020. His Diploma Thesis was titled: “Data Analysis on Keystroke Dynamics for Emotion Recognition using Machine Learning Models”. During his studies, he participated in the Erasmus student programme, where he took courses in the Information Techonology Department at the Brno University of Technology. His research interests focus on Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning and software development, as well as their applications on bioinformatics tools and pipelines.

Past Members

Dr. Maria Tsagiopoulou

Maria Tsagiopoulou, PhD, was warking as a postdoctoral researcher at INAB/CERTH. Her current position is as a pstdoctoral researcher at the Centro Nacional de Análisis Genómico (CNAG-CRG)

Anastasios Togkousidis

Anastasios Togkousidis was working as a research assistant at INAB/CERTH. He is currently pursuing a PhD at Heidelberg Institute for Theoretical Studies under the Computational Molecular Evolution (cme) laboratory.
